title: Canifis

properties.name: description
properties.value: Canifis is a small town in Morytania, which lies to the east of Varrock. It is only accessible to players who have completed the Priest in Peril quest. The town is inhabited by werewolves in human form, and many of the citizens and shops have references to dogs in their names. Canifis houses a secret base used by The Myreque, and is the starting point for a number of quests in the Myreque storyline.

Canifis is a small town in Morytania, which lies to the east of Varrock. It is only accessible to players who have completed the Priest in Peril quest. The town is inhabited by werewolves in human form, and many of the citizens and shops have references to dogs in their names. Canifis houses a secret base used by The Myreque, and is the starting point for a number of quests in the Myreque storyline.

Travel[edit | edit source]

  • To the north-west is Morytania Slayer Tower
  • To the south is the Mort Myre Swamp
  • To the west is Varrock
  • To the east is Port Phasmatys
  1. Players can teleport to Canifis using the Ancient Magicks spell Kharyrll Teleport.
  2. Alternatively, players can focus one of the portals in their Portal Chamber in their house to Canifis.
  3. You can also use a fairy ring with the code cks, which will teleport you just west of Canifis.
  4. In addition an ectophial may be used to teleport close to Canifis obtainable after the Ghosts Ahoy quest.
  5. A Salve Graveyard Teleport may be used to get to the graveyard outside of Canifis.
  6. A Slayer ring may be used to teleport to the Morytania Slayer Tower.
  7. Players can teleport very close to Canifis using the Fenkenstrain's Castle Teleport spell on the Arceuus spellbook. They can also use the corresponding teleportation tablet, which does not require being on the Arceuus spellbook.

Notable features[edit | edit source]

Bank[edit | edit source]

There is a bank in eastern Canifis.

Agility Course[edit | edit source]

The Canifis Rooftop Course is available to players with an Agility level of 40 or above.

Mazchna[edit | edit source]

Mazchna is the second Slayer master. His Slayer tasks are relatively easy and are mainly used by people with low combat levels.

Barker's Haberdashery[edit | edit source]

The clothes shop, Barkers' Haberdashery, is in the northern part of the city. All items cost 650 coins each, except for the capes which cost 20 coins each. Coloured gloves and capes are tradeable to free-to-play players, all other items are members only.

Tannery[edit | edit source]

Sbott the tanner will tan cowhides or dragonhides for you.

Taxidermist[edit | edit source]

The Taxidermist will stuff any monster heads or big fish you catch for a price. These stuffed items can be then used in a player-owned house.

Shop[edit | edit source]

The shop is more expensive than most other shops in RuneScape. It also sells thread and needles which can be useful for the Creature of Fenkenstrain quest.

Raw meat[edit | edit source]

The raw meat shop lies to the north of the bank.

Mushroom patch[edit | edit source]

The bittercap mushroom patch located west of Canifis is used in the Farming skill.

Inn[edit | edit source]

Roavar, the bartender of Hair of the Dog, will sell you a moonlight mead for 5 coins. There are also several quests related NPCs. There is a shortcut to Mort'ton down a ladder behind the inn (requires completion of In Search of the Myreque to access shortcut).

Monsters[edit | edit source]

  • Werewolf - If you attack any man or woman citizen of Canifis, they turn into level 88 werewolves. If you wield the Wolfbane dagger, you can fight the men and women without them turning into werewolves.

Other people[edit | edit source]

  • Vanstrom Klause
  • Malak
  • Dr Fenkenstrain
  • Ulizius

Music[edit | edit source]

  • Village
  • Stillness
  • Morytania
  • Fenkenstrain's Refrain
  • The Terrible Tower

Quests[edit | edit source]

  • In Search of the Myreque
  • In Aid of the Myreque
  • Creature of Fenkenstrain
  • Desert Treasure involves Canifis.
  • Wanted! involves Canifis.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • "Canifis" is likely named after canis, the genus of wolves, as the town is inhabited by werewolves.

See also[edit | edit source]

  • Slayer Tower
  • Mort Myre Swamp
  • Kharyrll

It is only accessible to players who have completed the [[Priest in Peril]] [[Quests|quest]]. The town is inhabited by [[Werewolf|werewolves]] in human form, and many of the citizens and shops have references to dogs in their names. Canifis houses a secret base used by [[The Myreque]], and is the starting point for a number of quests in the Myreque storyline. ==Travel== *To the north-west is [[Morytania]] [[Slayer Tower]] *To the south is the [[Mort Myre Swamp]] *To the west is [[Varrock]] *To the east is [[Port Phasmatys]] # Players can [[Teleportation|teleport]] to Canifis using the [[Ancient Magicks]] spell [[Kharyrll Teleport]]. # Alternatively, players can focus one of the portals in their [[Portal Chamber]] in their [[Player-owned house|house]] to Canifis. # You can also use a [[Fairy rings|fairy ring]] with the code {{Fairycode|cks}}, which will teleport you just west of Canifis. # In addition an [[ectophial]] may be used to teleport close to Canifis obtainable after the [[Ghosts Ahoy]] [[Quests|quest]]. # A [[Salve Graveyard Teleport]] may be used to get to the graveyard outside of Canifis. # A [[Slayer ring]] may be used to teleport to the [[Morytania]] [[Slayer Tower]]. # Players can teleport very close to Canifis using the [[Fenkenstrain's Castle Teleport]] spell on the [[Arceuus spellbook]]. They can also use the corresponding teleportation tablet, which does not require being on the Arceuus spellbook. ==Notable features== ===Bank=== There is a [[bank]] in eastern Canifis. ===Agility Course=== The [[Canifis Rooftop Course]] is available to players with an Agility level of 40 or above. ===Mazchna=== [[Mazchna]] is the second [[Slayer master]]. His [[Slayer task]]s are relatively easy and are mainly used by people with low [[combat level]]s. ===Barker's Haberdashery=== The clothes shop, [[Barkers' Haberdashery]], is in the northern part of the city. All items cost 650 [[coins]] each, except for the capes which cost 20 coins each. Coloured gloves and capes are tradeable to [[free-to-play]] players, all other items are [[members]] only. ===Tannery=== [[Sbott]] the [[tanner]] will tan [[cowhide]]s or [[dragonhide]]s for you. ===Taxidermist=== The [[Taxidermist]] will stuff any [[Skill Hall#Head trophy|monster heads]] or [[Skill Hall#Fishing trophy|big fish]] you catch for a price. These stuffed items can be then used in a [[player-owned house]]. ===Shop=== The [[General Store (Canifis)|shop]] is more expensive than most other shops in ''[[Old School RuneScape|RuneScape]]''. It also sells [[thread]] and [[needle]]s which can be useful for the [[Creature of Fenkenstrain]] [[Quests|quest]]. ===Raw meat=== The [[Rufus' Meat Emporium|raw meat shop]] lies to the north of the [[bank]]. ===Mushroom patch=== The [[Mushroom|bittercap]] [[mushroom patch]] located west of Canifis is used in the [[Farming]] [[Skills|skill]]. ===Inn=== [[Roavar]], the bartender of [[Hair of the Dog]], will sell you a [[moonlight mead]] for 5 [[coins]]. There are also several [[quests]] related [[Non-player character|NPCs]]. There is a [[Shortcuts|shortcut]] to [[Mort'ton]] down a ladder behind the inn (requires completion of [[In Search of the Myreque]] to access shortcut). ==Monsters== *[[Werewolf]] - If you attack any ''man'' or ''woman'' citizen of Canifis, they turn into level 88 werewolves. If you wield the [[Wolfbane]] dagger, you can fight the men and women without them turning into werewolves. ==Other people== *[[Vanstrom Klause]] *[[Malak]] *[[Dr Fenkenstrain]] *[[Ulizius]] ==Music== *[[Village]] *[[Stillness]] *[[Morytania (music track)|Morytania]] *[[Fenkenstrain's Refrain]] *[[The Terrible Tower]] ==Quests== *[[In Search of the Myreque]] *[[In Aid of the Myreque]] *[[Creature of Fenkenstrain]] *[[Desert Treasure]] involves Canifis. *[[Wanted!]] involves Canifis. ==Trivia== *"Canifis" is likely named after ''{{wp|canis}}'', the genus of wolves, as the town is inhabited by werewolves. ==See also== *[[Slayer Tower]] *[[Mort Myre Swamp]] *[[Kharyrll]] {{Canifis}} [[Category:Morytania]]
